type.title: Loot table type
type.description: The loot table's type. Will be used to validate the usage of functions and conditions

conditions.title: Pool conditions
conditions.description: The conditions which must pass in order for this pool to be used

rolls.title: Rolls
rolls.description: The number of rolls in this pool. If it is a range, a random number is chosen

bonus_rolls.title: Bonus rolls
bonus_rolls.description: The additional rolls given for each point of luck

entries.title: The entries
entries.description: For each roll, one of these entries is chosen to be given, with a chance based on the 'weight'

conditions.title: Conditions
conditions.description: The conditions that must pass for this pool/entry to be used

condition.title: Test entity properties
condition.descriptions: Test whether an entity describes in 'entity' can pass the predicate described in 'predicate'

scores.title: Scores to check
scores.description: The name of each sub-object is the score to check, it is either a number or a range

condition.title: Random Chance
condition.description: A random chance (ignoring looting) that the condition will pass

chance.title: Chance
chance.description: The chance that the condition will pass. i.e 0.3 means 30% chance.

condition.title: Looting Chance
condition.description: A random chance taking looting into account that the condition will pass

chance.title: Base chance
chance.description: The base chance that the condition will pass without any looting. i.e 0.3 means 30% chance.

looting_multiplier.title: Looting multiplier
looting_multiplier.description: The extra chance each level of looting adds to success

condition.description: This condition will pass only if the mob was killed by a player, unless the 'inverse' condition is set

inverse.title: Inverse
inverse.description: If true, the condition will only pass if the entity is not killed by a player

block.title: Block ID
block.description: ID of block. Test will fail if broken block doesn't match

condition.description: Checks tool (available for block breaking and fishing)
Passes with probability picked from table, indexed by enchantment level

chances.title: Chances
chances.description: list of probabilities for enchantment level, indexed from 0

condition.description: Joins conditions from parameter terms with 'or' ('disjunction')

entity.title: Entity to test
entity.description: 'this' for the entity which died to make the loot table, 'killer' for the entity which killed the entity, and 'killer_player' for the player who killed the entity (if it exists)

function.title: Function
function.description: This is a function which changes the properties of an item

function.title: Set Number
function.description: Set the 'count' of the items. Can be either an integer or a range. If it is a range it is set randomly within that range

count.description: The exact value or a range to choose a random value from to set the count to

function.title: Set durability %
function.description: Sets the percentage of the maximum durability

damage.description: The data value or a random value in a range to set the 'durability' to. 0.35 means 35% durability left

function.title: Set nbt
function.description: A function to set the 'tag' nbt of the item to the value specified in 'nbt'

tag.title: NBT string
tag.description: A string of nbt, which is escaped using the json format (a \ in front of each \ or ")

modifiers.title: Modifiers
modifiers.description: A list of modifiers to apply to the item.

attribute.title: Attribute to apply
attribute.description: The attribute modifier to apply to the item.

name.title: Custom name
name.description: The name of the attribute. Can be any string

amount.title: Modification amount
amount.description: The amount to change the attribute by. This can either be a single number or a range, with a `min` and `max` key

slot.title: Applied slot
slot.description: The slot to apply the attribute to. Can either be an array or a single string. If it is an array, it chooses one of the slots randomly

id.title: String UUID (optional)
id.description: A uuid to give to the attribute. If left blank it is randomised. They can be specified to allow (for example), items to be identical or to overwrite specific attributes by using another item (buggy)

function.title: Choose random enchantment
function.description: Chooses a random enchantment from the enchantments list. If it is not specified, a random enchantment (which is compatible with the item) will be applied instead

enchantments.title: Enchantments
enchantments.description: The enchantments to choose from to apply to the item

function.title: Enchanting table
function.description: Enchants the item randomly as if it were enchanted. The levels key is a range object (either an integer or an object). If "treasure" is true, then the enchantment may use treasure enchantments (mending or frost-walker)

treasure.title: Use treasure enchantments?
treasure.description: Whether the enchantment can include treasure enchantments (such as mending and frost walker)

function.title: Extra items with looting
function.description: How many extra items to add for each level of the looting enchantment applied. For example, a count of 10 with a looting level of 5 would give an extra 50 items

count.description: The exact value or a range to choose a random value from to add to the count for each level of looting

limit.title: Maximum
limit.description: The maximum number of additional items available

function.title: Smelt if possible
function.description: If possible, smelt the item. If it can't be smelted, nothing happens.
Converts an empty map into an explorer map leading to a nearby generated structure

destination.description: The type of generated structure to locate.

decoration.description: The icon used to mark the destination on the map. If mansion or monument is used, the color of the lines on the item texture will change to match the corresponding explorer map

zoom.description: The zoom level of the resulting map. Defaults to 2

search_radius.description: The size, in chunks, of the area to search for structures. The area checked is square, not circular. Radius 0 causes only the current chunk to be searched, radius 1 causes the current chunk and eight adjacent chunks to be searched, and so on. Defaults to 50.

skip_existing_chunks.description: Don't search in chunks that have already been generated. Defaults to true

function.title: Set name
function.description: Add display name of the item

entity.description: Will be used to parse selectors and scores defined in name

function.title: Set lore
function.description: Add display lore of the item

entity.description: Will be used to parse selectors and scores defined in each lore

replace.description: Should replace old lore or not

function.title: Fill player head
function.description: Set SkullOwner of a player head according to the specific player

entity.description: If it's not a player, nothing will happen

formula.description: Add random value using binomial distribution with n <- level + extraRounds and p <- probabilty
Add random value using uniform distribution from 0 to bonusMultiplier * level

function.title: Apply bonus
function.description: Apply one of predefined bonus formulas

enchantment.description: ID for enchantment level used for calculation

function.title: Copy name
function.description: Copy display name from block entity to item

function.title: Copy NBT
function.description: Copy nbt from the source to the target

function.title: Explosion decay
function.description: Apply flat chance (equal to 1/explosion radius) for every item to be destroyed (items in stack are processed separately)

function.title: Limit count
function.description: Limit count of every item stack to range

function.title: Set contents
function.description: Populate BlockEntityTag.Items (works for shulker boxes, chests, etc.) with items from entries

entries.description: list of entries (same as in pool)

seed.description: Seed (if omitted or 0, LootPoolSeed will not be set)

type.title: Item
type.description: This entry will give an item (if the conditions pass). The item type is defined in "name"

type.title: Loot table
type.description: This entry will give the result of another loot table specified in 'name'. These cannot be self referencing in any way, if they are self referencing, they don't run

name.title: Loot table
name.description: The loot table to be given

type.title: Empty
type.description: An empty pool. No items will be granted

type.title: Alternatives
type.description: Tests conditions of child entries and executes first that can run

type.title: Group
type.description: Executes child entries when own conditions pass. It behaves as multiple item entries (all with same weight and quality)

type.title: Sequence
type.description: Executes child entries until first one that can't run due to conditions

expand.title: Is expand
expand.description: If false, entry will return all contents of the tag, otherwise entry will behave as multiple item entries (all with same weight and quality)

quality.title: Weight based on luck
quality.description: Change the weight based on the players' luck attribute. This is calculated by weight + (quality * luck)

weight.title: Chance of this entry being used
weight.description: The chance of this entry being used

conditions.title: Entry conditions
conditions.description: The conditions which must pass in order for this entry to be used

type.title: Type
type.description: Specify random number generator. If omitted, defaults to uniform
